column4: does your vaio have the s1 and s2 buttons? what about the wifi switch? how well supported?
It has the s1 and s2 switches, though I don't use them, I seem to recall being surprised that they did stuff.. The wireless switch works fine as it's hardware based
good to know, i have a FE
I just tried out my "P1" and "P2" buttons
good to know
Gustaf's backlight FN+Fx doesn't work, that's hardware based too right?
I don't think so, IIRC, you need the sony tools installed. I did when I was running Gentoo at least, presumably Dapper automagically installed them already...
hm, nope, they aren't installed.
I've also noticed some support for sony- specific hardware in recent kernels, that may have something to do with it.
i saw that too, some of it was sound related
I'm pretty sure they aren't purely hardware (BIOS) based like the old models were.
every other laptop i've ever had (that i can think of) was pure hardware based
i find it hard to believe, but i wouldn't put it past sony
They didn't work on this machine whne I first got it. Took a lot of fiddling when I was running gentoo to make them cooperate. And on my old 505 they worked with no config
sounds good
still here?
yeah
I am back
does your vaio have a webcam built in?
nope
ah, ok
